content.description: The left-facing corner on the right side of the Treasure Chest, Gritty Kitty is a comfortable lead for those learning to trad climb.  The gear placements are surprisingly solid for sandstone and there are plenty of rests along the way.
content.protection: Gear up to 5 inches and a 2 bolt top anchor up top.

content.description:
This is the second from rightmost bolted route on the Treasure Chest, and if you can find the treasure chest, this is probably the first route you will see.  It is also the only bolted route right of the wide crack known as Gritty Kitty (5.7).

A slopey crack leads up to some very small hands that are definately the crux after the third bolt.  Hold on for the fourth clip, and easier climbing awaits above.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor.  To set up a top anchor, walk around above to the anchors, approaching them from the right.

content.description: start just to the right of "salty dog". this route goes up a series of good side-pull flakes and slopers, over a huge ledge where you basically get a no-hands, clip the 3rd bolt, then several final moves up top before exiting to a 2 bolt anchor. stick clip the first bolt if you're nervous about the first move but it's not hard and there are good holds. though the route looks easy, it turned out quite fun and challenging.
content.protection: 4 QDs plus a 2 bolt anchor. slings or QD's will be necessary to lower off as there are no chains or rap rings. sorry but i forgot to bring chain. the anchor is far enough back that you may grab your slings or QDs from the top on the way out. you may easily set a TR from the top as well.

content.description: Sweet hard moves left out of the big hueco. A right knee pad proved helpful at the bottom. The climbing is good and sustained. Burly crimps give way to technical and beautiful edging.
content.location: Shares a start with the Angler and Booty. It is the middle of the three routes that start in the cool hueco. Often chalked up.

content.description:
This route is FUN FUN FUN, and unique!

This route begins on the arete on the left side of the Treasure Chest area, and is the second bolt line from the left.  Climb up the left face of the arete - holds around the arete are on route as well - and into the strange roof-chimney.  Climb out of the chimney and up on the right side of the slightly overhung face above it.

I may be a little overly cautious giving this route the 's' rating, but climbing above the third bolt probably should scare you.  Once over the roof you can't see your last clip, and remember: that bolt was drilled in overhung sandstone.

This is an unsung classic, that I'd wager may be the best route on the wall. The bottom 2/3 of the route has a few technical sections between good jug rests, near the top is a long reach that would be very tough for shorter folks.

Be sure to anchor in the belayer to the crack at the base of the wall, waves do crash over the belay.
content.protection:
Bolts. A #1 cam can be used instead of a stick clip.

Easy walk off, no rap rings.
content.location: First route right of Captain Hook

content.description: Great route on fantastic holds. A bit sporty. Shares the last bolt with Capitan Crunch.
content.location: Two routes right of Capitan Hook.

content.description: Excellent short sport route hanging over the Pacific Ocean!

This route is just left of Gritty Kitty. Stay away from the jugs over there in the dihedral. The crux is short, and the route is fun. I heard it was 11c, but I don't recall it feeling that hard. Consensus grades would be great.
content.location: Just left of Gritty Kitty, shares anchor with Booty.

content.description: Do the first two bolts of Mr. Salty and continue left to a beautiful seam. Great rock. Very rarely has chalk.
content.location: Shares a start with Booty and Mr. Salty. Leftmost route of the three.
